course_title: ESL 510: Fundamentals of Graduate Writing I
class_notes:
(S/U Only)


Audience: 
LGS graduate students who use English as an additional language; 510 is designed and required for intermediate writers of English ; students in the advanced-low range can elect to take this course 
Meeting times: 
Once per week for 75 minutes with an additional 30-minute online lab; days/times TBD based on enrolled students' availability
Description:
Few skills will be as important to you as a graduate student and professional scholar as writing. ELSP 510 sets priorities for learning to help you build a solid foundation of writing standards, strategies, and skills to begin to position yourself as a successful writer in the academic community. To be recognized as a member of an academic community, you must write purposefully and accurately with a particular audience in mind, which requires effort. ELSP 510 emphasizes the importance of continuous practice, revising, and editing as participants further develop the important skill of writing. 
Contact: 
Heather Boldt, hboldt@emory.edu, Director, LGS English Language Support Program

To be recognized as a member of an academic community, you must write purposefully and correctly, which requires effort. ELSP 510 emphasizes the importance of continuous practice, revising, and editing in developing this skill.
